name: St. Apollonia
summary: Apollonia was a deaconess and virgin martyr who died in Alexandria during a local uprising against Christians. According to tradition, she was an elderly woman who was tortured, including having her teeth knocked out, and then thrown into a fire. She is the patron saint of dentists and those suffering from toothaches. Her martyrdom is described in a letter from Dionysius of Alexandria to Fabius of Antioch.
